meanings.definition: Undergo or cause to undergo a change or sequence of changes.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar was slowly mutating into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: The virus was mutating rapidly, making it difficult to develop a vaccine.
meanings.sent3: The recipe started mutating when the chef added too much salt by mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her feelings for him were mutating into something deeper and more complex.
meanings.sent5: The landscape was constantly mutating under the influence of the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: Change or cause to change in form or nature.
meanings.sent1: The artist was skillfully mutating the clay into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The weather was slowly mutating from sunny to cloudy.
meanings.sent3: The gossip was mutating into a wild rumor as it spread through the town.
meanings.sent4: His words were mutating her perspective on the situation, making her see it in a new light.
meanings.sent5: The chameleon was expertly mutating its colors to blend into its surroundings.
